quest.name: Under Lock and Code
journal:
 Quest Sync
Ambaghai has a need for your ability to solve problems, or rather, your ability to help others solve problems.
objectives: Speak with the perpetually perturbed Maelstrom officer.
Gather information and speak with the perpetually perturbed Maelstrom officer.

dialogue.name: AMBAGHAI
dialogue.text: Um... I beg your pardon, but I hear you're a womanman of the world. We've a slight problem, and your knowledge might help us solve it.

dialogue.name: AMBAGHAI
dialogue.text: Actually, they came to me first, but when it comes to anything other than the martial arts, I'm unable to provide much in the way of assistance. I did, however, offer to find someone who can, so hopefully I may yet make myself useful.

dialogue.name: AMBAGHAI
dialogue.text: A man of the Maelstrom is over by the storeroom, no doubt scratching his head as we speak. I'm sure he'd benefit from your wisdom.

dialogue.name: AMBAGHAI
dialogue.text: I imagine the fellow is still where I saw him last. He seemed determined not to give up until he'd exhausted every possibility.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: I was told someone'd come to help, but I never thought it would be you!

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: Well, now that you're here, I'd like you to take a look at this container we recovered from the Magna Glacies. It was one of several, in fact, and though we've succeeded in cracking the others open, this stubborn bugger refuses to yield!

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: All I know is a four-letter password is needed to unlock it. What that might be, I haven't the foggiest idea.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: There might be someone around here who either knows what it is, or can point us in the right direction. Could you try asking around for me?

dialogue.name: CITIZENA04224
dialogue.text: Sorry, I don't know the exact code, but given that the container belonged to the IIIrd Legion, perhaps the password has some sort of significance to them?

dialogue.name: CITIZENA04224
dialogue.text: I understand it's common for people to choose dates and so forth of special importance as their password. As for the members of the IIIrd, nothing springs to mind... Perhaps an anniversary or something along those lines?

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: Container? Sorry, I've never had much to do with them.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: But if you're after clues that could lead you to the password, a little background information on the IIIrd Legion might be of use.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: It was formed in the first year of Emperor Solus's reign and spent the first few decades engaged in campaigns across the northern territories.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: In the 42nd year, for its exemplary service to the Empire, it was assigned a new role─the protection of the capital, a far more prestigious position.

dialogue.name: HAWISIA
dialogue.text: As it's one of the IIIrd Legion's containers, you'd do well to seek out combinations of letters with some sort of importance to its history.

dialogue.name: WILLELM
dialogue.text: I've a feeling it's an anniversary or some such...but it could be anything...

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: Oh, have you already forgotten what I said? Very well, I'll tell you again. The IIIrd Legion was formed in the first year of the Empire. They were later charged with the protection of the capital in the 42nd year.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: That's all I can think of for now, but I'll let you know if anything else occurs to me.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What information will you convey?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Your conversation with Hawisia.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Your conversation with Willelm.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Your conversation with the soldier.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: None.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: It's only four letters─ How many possible combinations is that?

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: It belonged to the IIIrd Legion? Hmm... Finding someone associated with them might lead us to the answer.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: Anniversary? Not a bad idea, but this sodding thing doesn't have any buttons for numbers, only letters.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: I think you might be onto something there. The IIIrd was formed in the first year, and assigned to the capital in the 42nd... Trouble is, I've no way of entering numbers at all.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: If this belonged to the IIIrd Legion, they'd be the ones to pick the password. Most likely make it easy to remember.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: That information we got about the history of the legion might be a lead worth following, but we've no way of entering numbers, only letters.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: Wait─that's it! Garlean numerals! Let's see... If “3” is written as “III,” then...

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: ...If I take 42... Hold on... “XLII”? Is that right? Worth a try, I suppose.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: It worked! Ha ha! Now to inspect our treasure!

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: What the bloody hells is this? A flag!? Why would they bother keeping a thing like this locked away?

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: Well, I'll not pretend I understand their ways. Let's just assume they have a good reason for treating a bit of cloth with such reverence. Hmm... Probably best to leave it here undisturbed, as I've no intention of offending anyone.

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: Could I ask you to pass on word of what we've found? Oh, and thanks for your help!

dialogue.name: SOLDIERA04224
dialogue.text: Although the prize was obviously quite disappointing, finally breaking the code gave me a real sense of achievement. I couldn't have done it without you!

dialogue.name: AMBAGHAI
dialogue.text: So, has the investigation finally reached its conclusion?

dialogue.name: AMBAGHAI
dialogue.text: A Garlean flag... We'd be wise to treat it with respect. The chain it bears represents the unity between the people of the Empire, a unity that is all but lost.

dialogue.name: AMBAGHAI
dialogue.text: To think that this banner would be locked away rather than raised proudly...a relic of Garlemald's past. Though they have long been our enemies, to see its people brought so low... I...

dialogue.name: AMBAGHAI
dialogue.text: Forgive me, I have spoken overmuch. Though the search did not uncover any resources to speak of, at least the mystery of the locked container can be laid to rest. You have our thanks.
